errors.nodeConnect: Couldn't connect to node? See the logs for more:
errors.nodeStartup: It seems like the node couldn't be started, do you already have one running? Is it upgrading the database right now?

timeSync.title: Your computer's clock is not synced.
timeSync.description: To successfully synchronize with the Ethereum network you need to sync your computer's clock with a time sync server.
timeSync.win32: Go to your Internet Time Settings in your system preferences and check the box. See this guide for details: http://www.guidingtech.com/3119/windows-clock-sync/
timeSync.linux: To enable a time sync server install "ntp" via "apt-get install ntp".
timeSync.darwin: To enable time sync, open the time preferences and check "Set the time and date automatically".

nodeInfo.mainnetExplain: You are on the main Ethereum global network
nodeInfo.testnetExplain: You are on the testnet, DO NOT SEND any real ether to these addresses
nodeInfo.privatenetExplain: You are on a private net, DO NOT SEND any real ether to these addresses
nodeInfo.unknownnetExplain: Unable to determine which network you are on

startScreen.nodeConnectionTimeout:
Couldn't start Ethereum node!
If you installed Geth, use this command to run it:
geth --ipcpath __path__
Or report an issue
startScreen.nodeBinaryNotFound:
No Ethereum node binary found!
Please start one manually before.
startScreen.unableToBindPort: Ethereum node cannot run. Is another instance already running?
startScreen.nodeSyncing: Ethereum node needs to sync, please wait...

updateAvailable.newVersionAvailable: A new version of __app__ is available!
updateAvailable.noUpdateFound: No update found. You are running the latest version of __app__.

sendTransactionConfirmation.contractExecutionInfo: You are about to execute a function on a contract. This might involve transfer of value.
sendTransactionConfirmation.contractCreationInfo: You are about to create a contract from the provided data.
sendTransactionConfirmation.enterPassword: Enter password to confirm the transaction
sendTransactionConfirmation.estimatedGasError: Data can't be executed, so it will use all provided gas.

errors.connectionTimeout: Couldn't connect to the node, did it crash in the background?

onboarding.description: Ethereum is a decentralized platform for building apps on a blockchain: tamper-proof software that can transfer value and property and lives forever
onboarding.goToTestnetDescription: Test the technology freely in a sandboxed testnet, without using real ether.
onboarding.gotoMainnetDescription: You’ll need some Ether in order to create and execute contracts. Don't worry we'll help you get some...
onboarding.doYouHaveAWalletFile: Do you have a wallet file?
onboarding.walletFileDescription: If you participated on the Ethereum Pre-sale 2014, you should have a file named ethereum_wallet_backup.json. It was downloaded after the sale and also sent to your email
onboarding.protectDescription: Choose a password for your new account. Make it as strong as if it would protect your house keys!
onboarding.etherDescription: The ethereum network is based on token called “Ether”. You’ll need a small amount of it to do anything on the Ethereum network.
onboarding.loadItDescription:
If you already own Bitcoin, or any other cryptocurrency, you can easily convert it to ether using shapeshift.

We recommend loading somewhere between 0.25 to 1 ether.
onboarding.mineItDescription:
On the testnet you can mine ether yourself by going to the Develop menu and choosing Start Mining.
DO NOT ATTEMPT TO SEND REAL ETHER TO THIS ADDRESS
onboarding.tutorial1Description:
Now the only thing left to do is wait for the download to finish. Here's some reading suggestions:

Make your own money

Make a cryptocurrency with a fixed market supply, tokens representing real world assets, etc
onboarding.tutorial2Description:
Create a crowdsale

Raise funds for a common goal, fully trustable without a third party. Sidestep the hurdle of traditional funding system and go directly to the source by funding an organization via the blockchain.
onboarding.tutorial3Description:
Blockchain Organization

Create an autonomous organization with unbreakable rules on how money can be spent and who can make the decisions. Let your backers take an active role on how the money is spent

errors.nodeNotStartedYet: Wait a few more seconds until your node is fully started and try again

elements.checksumAlert: This address looks valid, but it doesn't have some security features that will protect you against typos, so double check you have the right one. If provided, check if the security icon matches.
elements.identiconHelper: This is a security icon, if there's any change on the address the resulting icon should be a completely different one
